metadata.title: CVE-2018-12392 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: When manipulating user events in nested loops while opening a document through script, it is possible to trigger a potentially exploitable crash due to poor event handling. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 63, Firefox ESR < 60.3, and Thunderbird < 60.3.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
